story: NewsAmber Rudd sparks Tory Cabinet row after talking up a second Brexit referendumThe Work and Pensions Secretary has been slapped down by Theresa May - as Andrea Leadsom responded by talking up No DealShareCommentsByBen GlazeDeputy political editorDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  DEC Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video watch-amber-rudd-would-money-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA top Tory has sparked a furious Cabinet row after declaring a second Brexit referendum is plausible. Remainer Amber Rudd became the first Cabinet minister to break ranks and say there was an argument for a new public vote. Today the Work and Pensions Secretary was slapped down by Prime Minister Theresa May. Brexiteer colleague Andrea Leadsom added a second vote was unacceptable - and opened new splits by talking up a No Deal brexit. Askedthe Prime Minister thought it was “plausible” to hold a second referendum, Theresa Mays spokesman said: “No.  “The Work and Pensions Secretary has been clear on three things: the priority is to get the vote through Parliament she doesnt want a peoples vote or a referendum and shes asked all colleagues to support the Governments deal. “The PM has been very clear on the dangers of calling a second referendum. “She is focused on winning the vote on the deal that has been agreed.” Brexiteer Leader of the Commons Andrea Leadsom said a second referendum would be unacceptable - and went further. Ms Leadsom insisted a managed no-deal Brexit is possible as Cabinet isions were laid bare.  The Commons leader suggested she had been looking at the option as an alternative solution to the Prime Ministers deal,that cannot get through Parliament. She told BBC Radio : A managed no-deal does not necessarily mean there is no Withdrawal Agreement at all. This is all speculation, but what I am looking at is trying to find an alternative that, in the event we cannot agree to this deal, that there could be a further deal that looks at a more minimalist approach that allows us to leave with some kind of deal and some kind of implementation period that avoids a clf edge, that avoids uncertainty for businesses and travellers and so on.  Ms Rudd made the comments that sparked the row last night. She insisted she did not want another vote and urged MPs to reach a consensus as a way of preventing a no-deal BrexitTheresa Mays withdrawal agreement is thrown out in Januarys vote. Ms Rudd told ITVs Peston: I dont want a peoples vote, or a referendum in general, butParliament absolutely failed to reach a consensus I could see there would be a plausible argument for it.Labours Owen Smith, a backer of anti-Brexit group Best for Britain, said: Amber Rudd may be the first Tory Cabinet member to say shed rather have a peoples vote than allow a catastrophic no-deal to unfold, but she wont be the last.This is a massive moment for our campaign. The PM is expected to be grilled on the comments when she holds a joint press conference with her Polish counterpart at Lancaster House.

title: foodbank stops playing christmas music
story: NewsFoodbank stops playing Christmas music as hungry families arrive for emergency parcelsThe centres volunteers dont want to fuel vulnerable peoples misery over the festive seasonShareCommentsByBen GlazeDeputy political editor:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA foodbank has stopped playing Christmas music because it “doesn’t feel appropriate” when hungry families are queuing for emergency parcels for the festive period. Volunteers have silenced seasonal tunes as hard-up Britons flock for vital supplies to get them through the holiday. The Mirror spoke to three foodbank managers as part of our End Hunger, Feed a Family Christmas appeal to raise cash for the Trussell Trust, Britain’s biggest foodbank network. While firm figures will be published in the coming months, all reported surges in demand for their lesaving packages. Debbie Shelley, of South Sefton foodbank on Merseyside, believed as many as three out of five hungry people walking through the foodbank’s doors are the working poor – evidence of poverty wages in Breadline Britain. Volunteers can become upset at the stories they hear as households reveal their heartbreaking reasons for seeking help.   She said: “Every so often there is one that just gets to you, especially on Christmas Eve. “People have come in and told me such sad things on Christmas Eve. “This sounds really awful but it doesn’t seem appropriate to have Christmas music on in the background. “Sometimes it does upset me, but at least I can try and do something for them.” Volunteers at South Sefton gave away , parcels from January to November this year. Over the same period in , they handed out , – meaning a .% rise over  months. And the run-up to Christmas always triggers a rise in need. “Last December we had a real spike - we gave out ,” said Debbie. “In a normal month, it’s  on average. “People often have devastating things going on in their lives, especially this time of year.  “People are finding it dficult to cope financially. “You might budget well all year but then Christmas comes andsomething  happens – your washing machine breaks or you have a bereavement – it just throws that into chaos.” Debbie, who was awarded an MBE last year, added: “It’s been a bit mental this week,” Hugh McNeill, of Coventry foodbank, agreed recent days had seen the traditional surge in need. He said: “It has been absolutely crazy. “Normally we see somewhere in the region of  to  people a month coming through. “But in December that tends to accelerate and we see more people.  “We’ve had over  people for this month so far - that’s in keeping with last year. “Butwe go back to  then it’s a % increase from then.” He blamed Universal Credit, the Government’s flagship welfare shake-up, for fuelling the surge in demand. “Universal Credit seems to be the hallmark of what we’re hearing this year,” he said. “It seems like every second person we talk to says about the issues they are facing with Universal Credit – delays.   “It is the main driving factor we are seeing now at thefoodbanksin Coventry. “Full roll-out started in July and we didn’t see a big kick-in straight away. “But since the beginning of November, more and more people are saying to us, ‘The reasons we are here are because of Universal Credit’. “It’s just overwhelmed people in its implementation and complexity, how dficult it is to navigate your way through the process.” In , , people used a foodbank in Coventry. Last December, volunteers gave away . tonnes of aid via the city’sfoodbanks– Hugh and is braced to hand out even more this month. “We are at the maximum we can work at,” he admitted. “It puts enormous pressure on us.   “Christmas is always an incredibly busy time for us.” At Work and Pensions Secretary Amber Rudd’s local foodbank in Hastings, East Sussex, coordinator Natalie Williams warned: “It has been really busy - we are always busy at this time of year.” She is ready for a fresh spike in January when Christmas bills start arriving and temperatures plunge. “It’s become a bit of a clicheacute but we genuinely see people having to make those decisions between heating and eating,” she said. “That tends to kick in more in January. “Boilers tend to break in the cold weather or pipes burst, and so suddenly there’s nothing left to deal with the kind of crisis. “We also have people who have struggled to make everything come together for their kids at Christmas, and then in January the reality hits that they have run out of their resources.”  Like Hugh, she believed UC was fuelling demand, identying a % rise since the benefit overhaul arrived in Hastings. Some desperate people have even credited the foodbank with helping them back from the brink of taking their lives. “It’s heartbreaking. You see people who are suicidal and some people have said to us, ‘You’re the only thing that’s stood between me and suicide’,” she said. “That’s a horrible thing to hear. Obviously it makes us glad that we are here and doing what we are doing, but it’s upsetting.” A Department for Work and Pensions spokeswoman said: “No one should have to face hardship with Universal Credit as we’ve made up to % advances available from day one and we know the vast majority of Universal Credit recipients are happy managing their money.”

title: mp compares herself jesus after
story: NewsMP compares herself to Jesus after shes found guilty of swapping speeding pointsFormer Labour whip Fiona Onasanya was found guilty of perverting the course of justice following an Old Bailey retrial for lying to police to avoid a speeding chargeShareByMikey SmithPolitical reporterNicola BartlettPolitical CorrespondentOliver Milne:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsFiona Onasanya was found guilty at the Old Bailey "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn MP who was found guilty of swapping speeding points has compared herself to Jesus Christ. Former Labour whip Fiona Onasanya was found guilty of perverting the course of justice following an Old Bailey retrial for lying to police to avoid a speeding charge. The -year-old solicitor was accused of colluding with her brother Festus after her car was clocked going mph in a mph zone in the village of Thorney near Peterborough. In a message which the Mirror understands was sent to her parliamentary colleagues, Onasanya began by comparing her experiences to the biblical figures of Joseph, Moses and Daniel. She said: In times like these the natural inclination of believers is to ask God why  I personally do not, because in my experience the answers are usually far above and beyond my reach. What I do know is that I am in good Biblical company along with Joseph, Moses, Daniel and his three Hebrew friends who were each found guilty by the courts of their day.

title: voice mirror delayed tory post
story: NewsopinionVoice of the Mirror: Delayed Tory post-immigration plans have satisfied no oneTheresa Mays latest white paper was a missed opportunity to help those where the impact of immigration has been felt the strongestShareCommentsByVoice of the Mirror:,  DEC NewsopinionThe latest flim-flam document from Theresa May adds little to an important debate "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAfter months of delay, the Government published its post-Brexit shyimmigration plans yesterday — and satisfied no one. Those seeking tougher rules will be disappointed that measures to limit low-skilled migration do not come into force for six years. Those seeking reassurance that our public services and companies will still be able to recruit the staff they need were warned that it could soon be much harder. Many people have legitimate concerns about the level of migration. But this flim-flam document adds little to the debate. Home Secretary Sajid Javid still wants a pound, salary threshold for those coming in despite warnings that it will leave hospitals and care homes dangerously understaffed. Theresa May’s arbitrary target to reduce net migration to the tens of thousands remains in place even though it has never been met. And there is nothing to help areas where the impact of immigration has been felt the strongest.  We need a system that is humane, benefits the economy and is accepted by the public. This white paper was a missed opportunity. Number’s up Everyone has a gripe about their insurance, broadband or mobile phone provider. So you would think companies would want to reward long-standing customers. Instead, these greedy firms milk loyal customers with stealthy price rises and rip-off exit fees which costs us an astonishing poundmillion a day.  The elderly, the low-paid and the vulnerable are most likely to end up paying over the odds in this racket, exposed by Citizens Advice. Ministers must now show they are on the side of customers by ending this scam. Storm brewing Caffe Nero needs to wake up and smell the coffee. Britain has had its fill of firms using complex accounting techniques to pay no corporation tax. If this continues, Caffe Nero’s customers should buy their coffee where.

title: young parents flocking foodbanks skipping
story: NewsYoung parents flocking to foodbanks and skipping meals because they cant afford to eat, says reportThe study for the Young Womens Trust laid bare the harsh realities for some poverty-stricken familiesShareCommentsByBen GlazeDeputy political editor:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC News "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailOne in  young parents has used foodbanks and many skip meals because they cannot afford to eat properly, according to a report revealed today. Research by the Young Women’s Trust suggested young parents with kids at high school are most likely to receive vital supplies from the leline centres. A survey of , people aged  to  indicated one in four was always in debt, while barriers faced by mothers in finding work piled extra pressure on stretched family budgets. The Trust’s Joe Levenson said: “Parents want to give their children the best but are facing huge financial challenges, especially over this Christmas period.  “A shocking number are having to skip meals or turn to foodbanks in order to feed their children, and many are getting into debt. “They are telling us they want to be financially independent but a combination of low pay and high childcare costs prevents that. “It doesn’t help that young people are entitled to less financial support and lower wages for no other reason than their age.” The study was published as the Mirror’s End Hunger, Feed a Family Christmas appeal continues to raise funds for the Trussell Trust, Britain’s biggest foodbank network. A Populus Data Solutions survey found two in five young women said it is a “real struggle” to make their cash last to the end of the month.  One in four admitted they are in debt “all of the time”. Mums who are in work often struggle too as they are more likely to be on low pay, with the Government’s national living wage only applying to workers aged  and over. Young women are also more likely to be in low-paid sectors, such as hospitality, care work and catering. Mr Levenson added: “This Christmas, the Government needs to step up to stop people going hungry.  “This means ensuring everyone who wants to work gets the right skills and support to find jobs, encouraging flexible working for parents and carers and paying a proper Living Wage that doesn’t discriminate against age. “This would benefit businesses and the economy too.” A Government spokesman said: “We’re committed to ensuring families get the support they need, and there are now one million fewer people living in absolute poverty compared with . “Both the employment rate and household incomes have never been higher and there are fewer children living in workless households than ever before. “For those families that need extra support, we are spending pound billion a year on working-age benefits and with Universal Credit, working parents can claim back up to % of eligible childcare costs compared to % on the legacy benefit system.”

title: gorgeous babies who spent first
story: NewsGorgeous babies who spent first Christmas fighting for le are celebrating miracle survivalBorn just before Christmas  with devastating heart defects they all underwent gruelling surgery when they were just days old but look at them now.ShareCommentsByRuth Huntman:,  DEC News "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailLooking at them now, it’s hard to believe that these adorable babies spent their first Christmas fighting for their lives. Born just before Christmas  with devastating heart defects they all underwent gruelling surgery when they were just days old. It should be a time when new mums are excitedly shopping for cute baby reindeer and Santa outfits and capturing their little angels’ excited faces on camera by the tree. But cruelly, the festive season was cancelled for the families of BeauEdward and Leoas they spent most of it at their babies’ hospital bedsides praying for a true Christmas miracle.Their prayers were answered and this Christmas, to mark their milestone, The British Heart Foundation got all three precious puddings together for a special festive shoot and film as part of the charity’s Christmas appeal,During pregnancy, Edward, Leo and Beau’s mothers got the bombshell that their children would be born with heart defects.  Leo’s mum Aimee Roberts, , from Bristol explains: “At my  week scan we were told baby had a hole in the heart but that it wasn’t serious and the hole would probably close by itself after he was born. But when he was born he was rushed off to Intensive Care for tests and that’s when we got the shattering news he actually had four major heart defects and would need immediate open heart surgery to stand any chance of survival. “At a week old Leo had a seven hour operation – he only weighed five pounds. Against the odds Leo came home for the first time on December rd but Christmas was cancelled as far as we were concerned. We just had pie and chips- what we’d found in the freezer - for Christmas dinner and we didn’t do presents, we just tried to get through it. “He came home with a personal nurse who looked after him on Christmas and Boxing Day but then we had to rush him back into AE the day after Boxing Day as his vocal cords was paralysed from all the bruising he’d got from tubes down his throat. We finally got him back home on New Year’s Eve. This year we are so grateful that we’ll have the traditional family Christmas we missed out on last year.”  Baby Beau was born in August last year with half a heartand had her first open heart surgery at just two days old and weighing just six pounds. She was on le support for a week but then began to recover well enough tohome after spending the first five weeks of her le in hospital. But just before her first Christmas she went into heart failure and was rushed back into hospital. Mum Demi feared the worst as Beau faced another open heart surgery at  months old. Demi and Beau managed tohome for Christmas last year, but Demi admits that the family struggled to celebrate because her daughter was still so poorly. “I am actually looking forward to Christmas this time, says Demi, , from Birmingham. “I cant wait to show her the trees, the baubles and the lights - I just want to spoil her. Its just so emotional, because we didnt think she would make it to one.”  Baby Edward’s mum Stephanie Lewis,  from Wales also had the worst Christmas of her le, Her son was born with Pulmonary Atresiaand had two keyhole heart surgery at just two days old to open up a valve in his heart. “But at six weeks old Edward deteriorated as he wasn’t getting enough blood supply to his lungs and he had to have open heart surgery. We also discovered also he had kidney problems. “Last Christmas was horrendous as Edward was not in one hospital but four being treated for ious complications. This will be his first Christmas at home and we are planning to go to town and make it one to remember. It was so emotional to see Edward looking so happy dressed in his little snowman outfit for the BHF’s Christmas campaign. He and the other babies really do sum up the spirit of Christmas.”

title: little boy enjoyed magical final
story: NewsLittle boy enjoyed magical final Christmas with his family before dying days laterKaty Parry and her family spent two Christmases in and around Claire House hospice after her son, Ewan, was diagnosed with a brain tumor in ShareCommentsByRobyn DarbyshireAudience Writer:,  DEC NewsKatys son Ewanwas diagnosed with a brain tumor in  "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA little boy enjoyed a magical last Christmas making memories with his family thanks to the amazing staff at a childrens hospice. Ewan Parry was diagnosed with medulloblastoma in  and despite two years of gruelling treatment he died in  when he was just seven years old. Speaking ahead of her third Christmas without her little boy, mum Katy has praised the staff at Claire House Hospice in The Wirral for helping to make his last two extra special. Even though the family opted to take him home for Christmas in  and , they visited the hospice for lots of fun festive parties. Katy told : Its a magical place at Christmas time, we went to events and parties - it doesnt matter what ability or disability the child has, theyre all treated equally.  We met Santa, they did all sorts of things like prepared tea, it was just magical. After his diagnoses in , the family stayed at the hospice while Ewan had radiotherapy at Clatterbridge hospital, and they opted to spend Christmas Day at home. We thought he was on the mend, and as hes a Christmas Eve baby they offered for us to come and stay but we made plans and wanted to have Christmas at home to try grasp a bit of normality, Katy explains. Following the first Christmas after Ewans diagnosis, Katy says his treatment damaged his brain which meant he then had to be fed through his stomach - which added to the traumatic ordeal for the family. He was such a bright lad and it was absolutely devastating. In the run up to Christmas , the family went to Claire House for lots of festive events. The family celebrated Ewans birthday, which is on Christmas Eve, and went to parties as well as making memories together, including a trip to London. We were inundated with Lego, because [the hospice] knew how much Ewan loved Lego, Katy said. They made a memory box for me of moments with Ewan, which we didnt know about until after he died.  The family were at Claire House on a planned stay on th December, when Ewan fell ill and didnt regain consciousness. He passed away in January . We believe he wanted to be there, Katy says. Although Christmas is a very tough time, Katy, her partner and daughter Niamh do still enjoy the festive period together. We wouldnt be here without the support of that place, they take on the burden during the worst thing you can ever go through in your le. We still do enjoy Christmas even though its a very hard time for us. Its special because of how much he touched everyone there. Its a place of hope. People think a hospice is where people go to die, but its really where you go to live and make memories. The effort they go to is above and beyond and were endlessly grateful.  Festive events at Claire House begin at the end of November when they hold the Light for Love event and light the Christmas tree in memory of all the children who have come to the hospice over the past  years. This year there has been four weeks of festivities, including Pantomime visits, visits from Santa and his reindeers, local choirs, and visits from Everton football club players. Jenner Bell, hospice manager at Claire House, said: Christmas is an amazing time at Claire House. But for some families this Christmas might be their last together, so we want to make it as special as we can.  There is always the sound of Christmas music and laughter. The play room is a hub of arts and crafts, and there is always a mince pie or two available for staff and visitors. On Christmas Day most families want to be at home. We do what we can to make this possible – including doing home visits and being on call in emergencies. The Hospice remains openwe have a child who is coming to the end of their le, or has sadly passed away. Staff then work over the Christmas period, and although this is a sad time, the staff know they are able to help a family when they need us most. You can donate to Claire House to support them in their important work here.

title: first picture heavily pregnant teacher
story: NewsFirst picture of heavily-pregnant teacher killed alongside unborn baby in Porsche crashAnna Kirsopp-Lewis, , was just weeks away from giving birth when she died in the devastating smash near Warminster, WiltshireShareCommentsByBradley Jolly:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsAnna Kirsopp-Lewiss death has devastated staff and students at Frome College "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThese are the first pictures of a lovely teacher who died alongside her unborn baby boy after a horror crash with a Porsche. Anna Kirsopp-Lewiss grey Peugeot collided with a black Porsche Cayenne on a busy dual-carriageway on Tuesday, police said. The heavily-pregnant -year-old was just a few weeks away from giving birth. Devastated students at the college where she taught media studies were reportedly told the news during a tearful assembly today. One A-Level student at Frome College in Somerset said: She was a lovely teacher, she was taken too soon. Another wrote online: Some of us are placing flowers outside Mrs Kirsopp-Lewis room, round the side of E block. Please place as many flowers as possible in her memory.  A third emotional student posted: You probably know but very sadly one of our teachers passed away, so in remembrance of her could you please wear something blue on Friday for our mufti-day because she was going to have a son. He also passed while she was pregnant with him in the accident. Please pull through guys this is the least we can do to remember a kind soul who was gone way too soon, so please guys just do this, cheers. And one mum said: Oh God, theyve just had a school assembly andsays all the teachers were crying. Now Im having a little cry. Mrs Kirsopp-Lewiss pregnancy yoga teacher also paid tribute to her. The teacher said: I am beyond devastated to hear about this. Anna was a lovely attendee to my pregnancy yoga classes over the past few months and was a joy to have known. I am just speechless in sadness and disbelief. I just cant make sense of it and I share this with a deeply heavy heart. No words. Heartbroken for her and her family.  Officers from Wiltshire Police raced to the scene on the A near Warminster on Tuesday morning, but the teacher was sadly pronounced dead. The -year-old driver of the Porsche was said to be in a le-threatening condition having been flown to hospital in an air ambulance. The road was closed for more than  hours as traffic accident investigators examined the scene for clues to what happened to cause the double tragedy. A spokesman from Frome College said today: It is with great sadness that Frome College announce that our Media teacher, Anna Kirsopp-Lewis and her baby lost their lives in a car accident on Tuesday. Anna was an inspirational teacher who cared deeply for all her students. She was a dear colleague, whose strength and commitment will be so missed by everyone at the College, and all who knew her. Our thoughts are with her family at this tragic time. As a mark of respect, the College will close at pm on Thursday  December for the Christmas holiday. Our Sixth Form Presentation has been cancelled, and will be rescheduled in the New Year.  In the New Year, we will plan a celebration of Annas le, and her great work here at Frome College. A police spokesman said earlier: The collision involved a black Porsche Cayenne and a grey Peugeot, which were both travelling in the direction of Bath. The driver of the Peugeot, a -year-old woman from the Warminster area, sustained signicant injuries and was sadly pronounced dead at the scene. We can confirm that the woman was pregnant and tragically, her unborn baby also died as a result of the collision. Our thoughts are with her family and friends at this extremely dficult time. They are being supported by a specially trained family liaison officer. The driver of the Porsche, a -year-old man from the Bath area, was airlted to Southmead Hospital in Bristol with serious injuries. He is said to be in a critical condition. Sergeant Andy Moreton said: This is an extremely upsetting incident. As part of our investigation to determine exactly what caused this collision, we would like to speak to anyone who witnessed it or who saw either vehicle immediately before. As well as this, we would like anyone with dash-cam footage who was in the area of the A near Warminster at around pm on Tuesday, to please get in touch immediately. You may have footage which could signicantly help with our inquiries.Anyone with information or footage is asked to contact Wiltshire Polices Roads Policing Unit on , quoting Log  of Tuesday  December. Alternatively, you can call Crimestoppers anonymously on   .

title: gatwick airport terrifying footage reveals
story: NewsGatwick Airport: Terrying footage reveals damage drones can do to planesThis remarkable footage may explain why bosses at Gatwick chose to close the runways and not risk the lives of pilots, crews, passengers or those on the groundShareCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills:,  DEC Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video watch-what-happens-drone-hits-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe terrying damage drones can do to passenger planes has been revealed in shocking footage of tests carried out earlier this year. Thousands of passengers are currently stranded after two drones were spotted near the runway at Gatwick Airport in West Sussex. Authorities took the decision to close the airport, erting planes already in the air and cancelling many others yet to take off. This remarkable footage, from the University of Dayton Research Institute’s Impact Physics Lab in Ohio, US, shows how even small drones can pose a risk to manned aircraft. It may explain why bosses at Gatwick chose to close the runways and not risk the lives of pilots, crews, passengers or those on the ground.  The research was a comparative study between a bird strike and a drone strike on an aircraft wing, using a drone similar in weight to many hobby drones. A wing was selected to represent a leading edge structure of a commercial transport aircraft. The drone and gel bird were the same weight and were launched at rates designed to reflect the relative combined speed of a fully intact drone traveling toward a commercial transport aircraft moving at a high approach speed.  Kevin Poormon, group leader for impact physics at UDRI, said: “We’ve performed bird-strike testing for  years, and we’ve seen the kind of damage birds can do. Drones are similar in weight to some birds, and so we’ve watched with growing concern as reports of near collisions have increased. And, as the footage shows, the impact was signicant. The drone is almost swallowed by the wing, leaving a huge gaping hole in the structure.Experts say drones could have catastrophic consequencesthey hit aircraft.  Dr Rob Hunter, head of flight safety at the British Airline Pilots Association , said: The public needs to understand that drones are not just toys and could have catastrophic consequencesthey collide with an aircraft. We know a lot of drones will be under peoples Christmas trees and we implore them to ensure theyre aware of the rules and fly their drones in a safe and sensible manner. These drone sightings at Gatwick are further evidence that tougher laws and enforcement are required to keep drones clear of manned flights. BALPA is also calling for the Government to consider toughening the law to create a larger no-fly zone around airports.  We need to ensure people flying drones take responsibility for their actions and do so responsibly with the knowledge thatthey endanger an aircraft they could face jail. Dr Hunter added: Even two kilograms of metal and plastic, including the battery, hitting an aircraft windscreen or engine or a helicopter tail rotor, could be catastrophic. People who buy these devices need to make sure that they know the rules and stick to them, so they dont put anyones le in danger.  Pilots dont want to ruin anyones fun butyou are going to use drones the message is clear: Know the laws or expect serious consequences. Before taking to the air have a really good think about where you are, keep your drone in sight, consider what aircraft might be flying about and keep clear - it is your responsibility. According to the British Airline Pilots Association , there were already  near misses between manned aircraft and drones up until November this year, compared to  for the whole of . This is not the first time an incident involving drones has been reported at London Gatwick. In October, it was reported that a drone put  lives at risk after nearly hitting an aircraft approaching the airport over the summer.

title: girls toys sign tesco dividing
story: NewsGirls Toys sign in Tesco is iding the internet in furious sexism row - but theres something  wrong with itTesco has come under fire for a sign in one of its stores advertising girls toys which many people are calling sexistShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  DEC NewsThe sign has sparked a heated sexism debate "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailShoppers have accused Tesco of sexism after spotting an aisle in an East Sussex store labelled for girls toys. An image of a sign from the Tesco Extra store, in St Leonards on Sea, was shared on social media by a customer named Rob Lowe last week. Mr Lowe argued that the sign wasnt really acceptable anymore and he felt it set a poor example for his young daughter, who loves unicorns and dolls but also enjoys playing with dinosaurs. He wrote: Come on Tesco. This isnt really acceptable anymore. My daughter loves unicorns and dolls. She ALSO loves robots, dinosaurs, rockets, monsters and Lego. Dont make me have to reassure her that this is ok.  His post has since gone viral, with almost , likes and hundreds of shares. Many people praised Rob for his post and agreed that the supermarket chain should remove the sign from their stores to allow children to pick whatever toy they want to play with, regardless of their gender. A fellow parent branded the sign ridiculous. She said: Ridiculous! Mum of  girls that also like cars, dinosaurs and superheroes. Yes it does matter - its the inherent sexism that girls and women face through their le. This is just for boys.  Another person added: Please Tesco, please remove signs identying toys for girlsor boys . This is , boys and girls must both have the opportunity of a wider choice of toys . You have a responsibility to your customers, me and my extended family included. A third simply wrote: Gender marketing is lazy and sexist. TV writer Donna Fanceschild also couldnt help but notice the grammar mistake in the sign - and claimed Tescos lack of an apostrophe was just more evidence of sexism. She commented: Plus, how is she supposed to get to grips with English grammarTesco omits the crucial apostrophe indicating the possessive   Perhaps they dont think girls should be worrying their pretty little heads about that. However there were many people who thought Rob was overreacting. One Twitter user posted: If I was shopping for my daughter Id find this very helpful. Another slammed people who were offended by the sign.  They said: Has anyone actually met a person thats offended by the absolute nonsense gender fluid bulls*** going on at the moment  Apparently Tesco has a girls toys aisle and people are unhappy  Who are these freaks  Someone  tweeted: Tesco are purely labelling an aisle for stock purposes and the name is irrelevant. Hence the meat aisle has meat and the veg aisle has veg. Who said robots arent girls toys  Or are you assuming that every girls toy must be pink and fluffy  Putting an end to the heated debate, Tesco have admitted that the signs are no longer appropriate. A spokesperson for the company said, “We agree toys are for everyone and removed the ‘Girls’ Toys’ and ‘Boys’ Toys’ signage from our stores several years ago, but it appears that this one was missed. We will have it changed to the new signage as soon as possible.”

title: madeleine mccann search not stop
story: NewsMadeleine McCann search will not stop until it reaches conclusionMadeleine McCann vanished during a  family holiday in Portugal and politan Police commissioner Cressida Dick says they will continue the hunt until they find out what happened to herShareByJerry Lawton:,  DEC NewsMadeleine was three when she was last seen on holiday with her parents in Portugal in May  "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe search for missing Madeleine McCann will not stop until it has reached its conclusion, Britains top police chief has vowed. politan Police commissioner Cressida Dick has revealed they will continue to exhaust all possible lines of inquiry despite cash being tight in the force. She told the Daily Star: “I am quite happy it should continue until we find out what happened or we have exhausted all possible lines of inquiry. Ms Dick has also spoken of how she was part of the team that set up the Operation Grange inquiry into the youngster’s  disappearance in Portugal. It came after a personal plea by Madeleine’s doctor parents Kate and Gerry to then Prime Minister David Cameron.   Ms Dick, who was an assistant commissioner in the Met at the time, said she had supported the move by the force to launch a probe into the mystery even though it appeared to have no jurisdiction. Madeleine vanished abroad and her family’s home force in the UK was Leicestershire. Since then Scotland Yard has spent nearly poundmillion of taxpayers’ cash on the inquiry but no-one has been charged. Last month, the Home Office granted the force an extra pound, to continue the probe until at least April next year.   The move sparked criticism from the Police Federation and some former Met officers who argued the money would be better spent tackling London’s record number of homicides, kne crime and terrorism. Britain’s top police officer said she understood their concerns but felt the Madeleine investigation was too important to shelve and she had set no time limit on it. Ms Dick said: “I was there when it was set up originally. “I remember when this piece of work was started and why. “I can understand why some people may feel dferently but I think it is quite right that we should continue until it has reached its conclusion.’’   Ms Dick admitted the Met was still short of cash despite Home Secretary Sajid Javid last week pledging an extra poundbn to forces nationwide. The commissioner said the Force could benefit from an extra poundmLondon mayor Sadiq Khan chose to generate the maximum amount possible via council tax rises. But she admitted that may not be enough to save officers’ jobs following years of cutbacks. However she said that would not impact on Operation Grange. She said: “It’s not a huge amount of money and it’s not large number of officers.” Referring to the force’s determination to trace and bring to justice the poisoners of Salisbury spy Sergei Skripal she added: “We never give up in the Met. “We never have. “We never forget.” The news will come as a massive boost to Madeleine’s parents who earlier this year had feared it could be shelved and they would have to fund expensive private detectives to continue the search.   Then-three-year-old Madeleine vanished from the family’s holiday apartment in the Algarve resort of Praia da Luz  years ago while her parents dined with pals in a nearby tapas bar. Portuguese police archived the case as ‘unsolved’ in . They are now working alongside Met detectives in a bid to determine what happened. Last month it was revealed both forces were probingMadeleine had come to harm after walking out of the apartment in a bid to find her parents. Until then the Met thought she either disturbed burglars or was abducted. The McCanns continue to believe she was snatched from her bed by an intruder and may still be alive. Ms Dick declined to discuss ‘operational details’.

story: NewsBully boyfriend installed camera in house to mock size  girlfriends weightJanusz Jelen, , from Ashton-under-Lyne, Greater Manchester would taunt his partner Agnieszka Mogilska through the camera and say her "thighs were shaking"ShareCommentsByHayley Sewell:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsJanusz Jelen was given a  week jail term suspended for a year and issued with a  month restraining order "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA man installed a camera in his lounge so he could use it to spy on his girlfriend, mock her weight and checkshe was cheating on him. Janusz Jelen would watch Agnieszka Mogilska while he was at work by logging onto a device on his iPhone. Through a speaker he would ask the mother-of-two to raise her arm to seeshe had any fat and to suggest she wear trousers as he claimed her thighs were shaking. He would also eavesdrop on conversations the -year-old was having with her friends. Machine operator Jelen, , has been banned from contacting Ms Mogilska over his oppressive and degrading behaviour.   Police were called in after Ms Mogilska, a production worker at a lighting company said the she felt like she in a mental hospital with  hours a day surveillance. In a statement she said: As a result of this relationship I do not like my body. Im always covering my roll of fat on my stomach by crossing my arms and do not like the fat on my thighs, despite wearing a size . I sleep less and I am exhausted all the time and have been terried since it ended. I was in a domestic violence relationship before with my ex husband and I cant believe this is happening again. I have been struggling since. At Tameside magistrates court, Jelen was convicted at an earlier hearing of an offence of engaging in controlling and coercive behaviour between November  and October this year.   He was given a  week jail term suspended for a year and issued with a  month restraining order. He was also ordered to complete a  month community order plus  hours of unpaid work. He will pay court charges of pound. The couple, who moved to the UK from their native Poland had been dating for two years but arguments began when Jelen laughed at her about her English pronunciation. Miss Mogilska said: At first I felt very happy and loved but then there were allegations made every day that I am fat and stupid and that I didnt know English. He said my children are stupid and that they will be deported back to Poland because they dont know English. He said I would not get help here, the only help I would get isI got with a man who was English. He gave me psychological abuse. I told him I would rather he had hit me in the face because that would stop hurting - but the words dont.   He observed me through cameras, and he told me to lt my arm to see my fat. I put on shorts when it was hot and he followed me, and told me to put on long trousers because my thighs were shaking. I spoke English but he would laugh at my pronunciation. Several times a day he would say things about me or my children. The camera was installed in July . He had an application on his phone which enabled him to watch the camera from work. When I tried to turn it off he would text me to say to put it back on and would watch all the time. I told him I didnt like the cameras and he said that it was there for my safety because he loves me. I felt like I was in a mental hospital with  hours a day surveillance. When my friends came over he was listening to our conversations.   He didnt like some of my friends and tried to cause conflict between me and them which caused one of them to stop seeing me. He tried to say I had other lovers virtually all the time andI went somewhere, he would say I was seeing other people. I did not pick his friends for him so he cannot pick mine. Everyone has rights to have their freedom. I would go out in the day as I didnt want to see him and he works at night. I would go out and it would cause arguments. He said he would kill my other lover and he followed me when I went to the shop. I asked him to take down the camera and do this so we could split up peacefully like human beings but things got worse. We were arguing non-stop and he would then apologise and give me flowers. I was fed up and went to the police.   I did warn him beforehand that I would and he was laughing at me saying no one would help me. I went to the shop which caused an argument and he said you dont go to the shop at this hour. When I went through the door he said I am going to kill you b*tch and him too. I was walking towards the shop and I was on the phone. On the way back my daughter rang me and said he had left home. I felt like someone was following me or watching me. At first I felt very happy and loved. There was a situation when he came in from work before I went to the police. He came in the bedroom as he thought I was sleeping with someone. He took my arm and pushed me and said who the f*** did you sleep with. He wouldnt let me sleep in his bed or the sofa as he said they belong to him.   Jelen, who is currently single, denied wrongdoing. His lawyer Saul Comish said: The cameras had been installed for over a year and there was no complaint for a while. The comments he made were hurtful and the camera was there recording her in the house. But he never controlled her movements or who she could associate with. There are some cultural elements to this as this type of offence is not common in Poland with this type of behaviour. He accepts what he did, he recognises that the relationship is over and has not made contact with her.   But a probation report read to the court said: I believe there are elements of sexual jealousy as motivation for this offence as he thought she was in another relationship and made threats to the other potential male. There is no insight into his abusive behaviour and to some extent there is some sense of entitlement. There is no previous record of abusive behaviour but the offences were over a prolonged period of time. This was his first long-term relationship so he may do this again unless his thinking is changed. Chairman of the bench Jill Simpson told Jelen: We believe you displayed oppressive treatment intended to degrade her. You will need to mody your behaviour.

title: parents reveal words kids say
story: NewsParents reveal words their kids say that leave them completely confusedNearly half of adults revealed they wish they could speak more confidently to younger peopleShareByRichard Jenkins:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsAdults have admitted to being baffled by kids conversations "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe phrases gram and pwned leave mums and dads scratching their heads as they try to decipher what on earth their offspring are talking about, it has emerged. Researchers who polled , parents and their children aged - revealed  per cent of adults wish they could speak more confidently to other generations. More than one in four had no idea the ‘gram’ was social media  Instagram, and nearly four in  didn’t know ‘hangry’ is a portmanteau used when one is angry due to hungriness. And only one quarter were able to identy that to be ‘pwned’ means being ‘owned’ – i.e losing an argument online. In fact, one in five adults believe it was just a mis-spelling of ‘pawned’.  A further  per cent didn’t know that ‘The Gram’ refers to social media site Instagram. To bridge the generational language gap, O and the NSPCC have launched a quiz pitting the digital knowledge of parents’ against their kids. Nina Bibby, Chief Family Officer and CMO of O said: “With our partnership with the NSPCC, we want to help parents have regular conversations about the online world and how to navigate it safely. “As a mother I know how tricky this can be, and that’s why the Parents vs Kids quiz is a brilliant way to get the whole family together and test each other’s digital knowledge, whilst learning about online safety and having fun too.” The study also found three in  parents were unable to identy Zoella as a famous British YouTube star.  And  per cent bizarrely believe the acronym ‘TBT’ to stand for ‘Tomorrow Basketball Time’ rather than ‘Throwback Thursday.’ Another third find themselves baffled by ‘FTW’, which stands for ‘For The Win’ – meaning something is good. Thinking back to their own childhoods, just under half of Brits remember there being a language gap between themselves and their elders. And it also emerged children from eight to  are more confident speaking about who has the most views on YouTube or celebrity culture rather than topics taught on the school curriculum, including history, politics and science.  Laura Randall, associate head of Child Safety Online at the NSPCC said: “It is really important for parents to have regular and open conversations, no matter how old their children are, about how they are using the internet. “Parents vs Kids will help to facilitate that conversation while exploring the online world in a fun and inclusive way.” The Parents v Kids quiz is available on Amazon Alexa and is designed to be played between parents and children aged from eight to . The quiz features television presenter Lauren Layfield asking the kids questions, and comedian and Pointless presenter Richard Osman as the voice for ‘Team Parent’.The study of , adults and their children was conducted via OnePoll .

title: uk weather forecast christmas getaway
story: NewsUK weather forecast:  flood alerts in place with Christmas getaway under threatThe Met Office is predicting days of wet and windy weather for much of the UK - but will it be a white Christmas ShareCommentsByChris kitching:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video white-christmas-year-watch-forecast-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThunderstorms and gales are set to hammer parts of Britain, threatening to disrupt Christmas getaways for millions and putting homes and roads at risk of flooding. Violent weather systems are bringing days of heavy rain in the lead-up to the big day next week. There are already  flood alerts in place following weeks of soggy weather that has left some streams swollen and the ground saturated. Wet and windy weather will persist into the weekend, the Met Office says, as millions travel by car, rail or air to visit family over the holiday, or finish their Christmas shopping.  The conditions threaten to disrupt travel and forecasters have warned that some streams could breach their banks and flood homes, businesses or roads. The government has warned Britons to be prepared as flooding is possible. Meteorologist Alex Deakin said people in some places will wake up to a “rumble of thunder” on Thursday morning. Drivers should take care during the commute on rain-slicked roads. The Met Office forecaster told the Express: “All the heavy showers are mulling around an area of low pressure, and there is more where that came from. There will be more low-pressure systems and more weather fronts, which will bring heavy rain.”  The worst conditions are expected in the south-west of England, although heavy rain will move northwards through the day. Heavy showers are likely during the evening commute. The Met Office said Friday will be grey and wet for most of the UK, with gales around coasts. Its been dubbed Frantic Friday because schools break up that day and millions of Britons will begin their Christmas getaways. The AA is expecting  million vehicles on the roads, and the RAC is predicting the most congested getaway rush for years. Those trying to fly into or out of Gatwick Airport on Thursday faced major disruption, with its lone runway closed due to drones buzzing over the airfield.  Saturday will see bright spells and scattered showers as many people make their last-minute shopping trips. There will be further outbreaks of rain from Sunday through the start of next week, including Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. Christmas Day will be mild in most places, with increasing amounts of dry weather, the Met Office said. Is there a flood alert in your area  Twenty-four flood alerts are in place across the country this morning - although these are being updated on a regular basis.The current warnings are:North East EnglandUpper River Ouse North West EnglandUpper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water  The MidlandsBow and Piddle Brook River Leadon Catchment River Lugg south of Leominster River Wye in Gloucestershire River Wye in Herefordshire South East England Cuckmere River Loxwood Stream River Beult from Pluckley and Bethersden to Hampstead Lock at Yalding River Rother and its tributaries from Turks Bridge to the Royal Military Canal Upper River Stour Western Rother South West EnglandEast Somerset Rivers Lower Avon and tributaries Lower Frome and tributaries Mid Bristol Avon Area Middle Stour and tributaries River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches South Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches Upper Bristol Avon Area Upper Stour and tributaries Met Office five-day forecast Thursday Some dry and sunny spells today, but with blustery showers from time to time. The showers will be heaviest and most frequent in the north and west, with southern and eastern parts dry for a good portion of the day. Thursday night Heavy rain arriving in southwest England and Wales later, spreading into the rest of England, Wales and Northern Ireland during the early hours. Scotland seeing scattered showers and some frost.  Friday Grey and wet for England, Wales and Northern Ireland, with gales around coasts. A dry spell across southern England and Wales, but more rain later. For Scotland, sunshine and showers. Saturday to Monday Saturday bright spells and scattered showers. Sunday and Monday cloudy with outbreaks of rain for many, although perhaps drier in the north, especially on Monday. Will it be a white Christmas  The Met Office says: There is low confidence in the forecast as we head into the Christmas period. However, central and western areas are more likely to see cloudy skies and outbreaks of rain on Christmas Eve, whilst it will most likely be drier and brighter where. Meanwhile, many will most likely see a mild day on Christmas Day itself, with increasing amounts of dry weather. Thereafter, as we continue towards the end of the year, southern parts will probably see a good deal of dry weather, although with this settled weather comes an increased risk of overnight fog and frost. Northern parts, meanwhile, look set to see more changeable weather, with showers or longer spells of rain at times.

title: universal credit forces single mum
story: NewsUniversal Credit forces single mum to tell kids they wont get gts from SantaSuzanne Coates, , says she was forced to reveal the truth to her two daughters as she cannot afford to buy them presents as she waits for her benefit claim to be processedShareCommentsByJoanna Lovell:,  DEC Updated:,  DEC NewsSuzanne Coates, with her daughters Bethany and Gracie May "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA single mum says she has been forced to tell her two young children that Father Christmas wont be bringing them gts this year after being left with just pound to survive off for the next five weeks. Suzanne Coates said she had no choice and wanted to save their disappointment on Christmas Day after a move to Universal Credit left her unable to afford to buy them any presents. The -year-old is now postponing the festive day until February when her benefit claim will have been processed, reports Hull Live. But she has been left in tears with stress at the thought of breaking the magic around Santa to daughters, Bethany,  and Gracie Mae, .  I feel really bad because Ive said to the kids Santa isnt real, I do it, I go shopping, I put your presents out. I told them everything, she said. Ive been crying so much recently, Ive been an emotional wreck, I feel poorly constantly, stressing about it. I didnt want to tell them but I had no choice. Ms Coates switched to the new controversial benefit after getting a job as a cleaner, which meant she had to come off Job Seekers Allowance - which she had claimed for ten years - and claim for Universal Credit instead. Universal Credit is paid monthly in arrears, so applicants have to wait one calendar month before they receive their first payment and then have to wait up to seven days for the payment to reach their accounts, which can leave them short for five weeks. But the mum was determined to get a job to make a better le for her and her daughters. She said she hated the job centre where she claims she was treated like dirt. However, she now wishes she had stayed on Job Seekers Allowance.   She said: I wish Id stayed on JSA because at least I had stability in the old system. You knew where you were with money and when you would get paid, it goes into bank every four weeks, but now Im going from one month the other not knowing what money Ive got. I know youre meant to feel great when you get a job but I dont feel great, I just want to pack it in. Universal Credit is just rubbish, theres no stability in your le. I dont know how Ill manage, but we do, we buy from charity shops, I budget, I always make sure Ive got a full freezer. Ms Coates said she will postpone Christmas until February, when she will have received her first months wages. She said her children seem to understand, and has promised them she will still make sure they have a happy Christmas.   She said: They know they have to wait for their main gts, they are still getting a little something but not what they have asked for all year round. But were still going to have a good Christmas, but more of happier one. Because of me telling them about Santa I feel a bit more happier knowing that they understand and know they know why Ive been so upset, which I have. I said they will get stuff but they wont have surprises because I aint got help from anyone . They know not to be spoilt, theyve had the odd few gts that they didnt know about in the past but Ill add them when I do a second Christmas in February. The Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of Universal Credit and for a review to take place. We say there are three options:Redesign UC to be fit for purpose Axe it in favour of the old systemUC is unfixable Introduce a brand new systemSign our petition to stop the rollout of Universal Credit across Britain and to replace it with a fairer system by signing our petition.  Usually Im an organised mum but this year I changed and got a job to make something better for me and the kids and its ended up worse. Previously, on the issue of Universal Credit a Department of Work and Pensionsspokesman has said: “Universal Credit simplies an out-of-date, complex system with evidence showing that under UC claimants are getting into work faster and staying in work longer. “Our research shows that many people join Universal Credit with pre-existing arrears, but the proportion of people with arrears falls by a third after four months in UC.

title: driver who fell asleep wheel
story: NewsDriver who fell asleep at wheel crashes into THREE Ferraris leaving him with £k billLin Chin-hsiang, , has now received donations from dozens of strangersShareCommentsByBradley Jolly:,  DEC NewsThe Ferraris were damaged in the accident "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA young driver who fell asleep at the wheel and ploughed into THREE Ferraris must cough up the equivalent of pound, to repair the sports cars. Lin Chin-hsiang, , had worked a nightsht at a restaurant before he crashed his vehicle into the parked luxury cars at around .am on Sunday. The Ferraris were among four sports cars which belonged to a group of friends who were meeting up before a scenic drive.The owners were standing near the vehicles, but fortunately no one was injured. Now, Mr Lin, a college dropout, has been told he faces a repair bill of  million Taiwan dollars .   I thought: Oh no, Ive gotten myself into a big mess. I was really worried about bringing trouble to my mother and having to pay so much money, he told the BBC . There has been a public outpouring of support for Mr Lin since the incident, with donations made by strangers across Taiwan.The young man, who is from a single parent family and has helped his mum run the family shop in addition to his own job, has been overwhelmed with he support in his country.   Many low income families in Taiwan have in recent years been left struggling to make ends meet due to the islands widening wealth gap. Mr Lin added: Im really grateful to everyone who has offered to help and who has come here to encourage me. Some people even drove up from central Taiwan and asked me where they can donate money. story: NewsWorlds heaviest man who once weighed  STONE goes under kne to save his leJuan Pedro Franco has lost an impressive lbs after taking on a strict diet - but his weight is still putting him at extreme risk of cardiac arrestShareCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills:,  DEC Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news world-news video worlds-heaviest-man-goes-under-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,swipeNavigation:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe world’s heaviest man is set to go under the kne for the second time in a bid to save his le - after shedding a staggering  stone.Juan Pedro Franco was officially named the heaviest man on Earth in December , weighing in at a huge  lbs, or st lbs. In , the -year-old, from Guadalajara, Mexico, underwent le-changing surgery to remove  percent of his stomach. Since then, he has been living on a strict diet and has lost an impressive lbs - but his weight is still putting him at extreme risk of cardiac arrest. This means he needed further surgery. Juan said: The most important thing for me is to walk again. I haven’t left the house for six years or even walked anywhere.”  Growing up, Juan was always overweight but a bus accident in his late teens left him in a coma and bed bound. He said: I broke half my body. I broke all of my right side ribs, leg, everything.” Over the last couple of years, Juan’s weight-loss progress has been monitored by bariatric surgeon, Dr Jose Castaneda Cruz.He also carried out both surgeries. Juan’s second operation reduced his stomach even further, to create a pouch smaller than an egg. The pouch will bypass his lower stomach and connect to his small intestines. The surgery was le-threatening, but the former worlds heaviest man had no choice. Dr Castaneda said: Death in these patients is likelythey dont get treated we have to risk it because its a le opportunity for the patient. The journey to the hospital was the first time the keen baker had left the house in six months. Juan’s specially strengthened bed had to be dismantled and set up again for him in hospital, as he was too heavy for a normal bed.  The invasive surgery only took an hour and Juan recovered well. He is now on a strict diet and exercise regime to lose a further  lbs in  months. In six months, Juan lost  lbs and now weights under  lbs or  stone - almost half his original weight.His dream of being able to walk again has also come true. He said: Its a really big achievement for me to get up take two, three steps. But I’m very happy you can see Im already starting to move. Juan still needs to lose weight over the next year. But he looks forward to the day when hell be recognised for achieving another world record. He said: If one day I gain the title ‘the man who lost the most weight’ then I will celebrate.”*Body Bizarre is on Saturdays at pm on TLC UK

title: aberdeen thumping proves we need new signings says dundee boss jim mcintyre
story: Dundee’s thumping at the hands of Aberdeen has strengthened boss Jim McIntyre’s desire to bring in reinforcements during the winter transfer window.The Dens gaffer branded his side “meek” as they were “bullied” by the Dons in a - hammering.Two goals in the first half for striker Sam Cosgrove, two for defender Andy Considine and one for youngster Connor McLennan had the dominant Dons cruising to victory.And that display has only reinforced the manager’s view that new faces are needed to get Dundee out of relegation trouble.He said: “We know work is needed to be done. That was always going to be the case no matter the result.“We’ve got some good players but we need some help.“We’re bottom for a reason so we’ve got to try to strengthen otherwise it’ll be a long season.“I don’t look at where we are just now.“I look at performances, responsibility taken by players in games and the consistency of what we’ve been getting, the decisions being made when a couple of things go against us and how we react.“That’s what I look at and will determine what I need.”Right from kick-off the Dark Blues were second best as Aberdeen moved to within a point of leaders Rangers.Cosgrove’s strikes in  and  minutes sealed the points before calamity at a corner where Andy Boyle and Nathan Ralph bundled each other over to allow Andy Considine a free header just after the break signalled a long second half ahead for the Dark Blues.The manager said: “It wasn’t good enough. Simple. No excuses. We were miles off it. Aberdeen were stronger and quicker and bullied us.“We were too meek. We need to show far far more.“When you look at the corners and losing at set-plays – you’re assigned a man and it’s not the first time I’ve seen it.“It was frustrating and disappointing. It was our game in hand but it was an opportunity.”Gensy Kusunga and Lewis Spence were both forced off through injury.Jim added: “Kusunga looks like he’s hurt his hamstring. Spence is fine, he just aggravated a nerve. He could maybe have played on.”

title: baffled dundee woman finds christmas presents bound for poland on her doorstep
story: A woman was left scratching her head after Christmas presents bound for Poland arrived on her doorstep.Patricia Webster, , found a note on the step of the communal close which said a parcel had arrived for her daughter.The package – sent last Thursday – was placed in a storage box at the side of her home on Arklay Street.The label on the parcel suggested it was both for Patricia’s daughter and someone , whose address was marked as Grojeckie, Poland.The situation became even more confusing when her daughter revealed she wasn’t due to receive anything in the post. vw, px"  Patricia said: “The package must have been the size of a crisp box.“My daughter has moved out but as far as she was aware she wasn’t expecting anything to arrive at my house.”Patricia opened the box to find six wrapped Christmas gts, marked for the address in Poland.She added: “The package could have been picked up by anyone as the note had been left on the staircase.“But I quickly discovered my daughter was not the intended recipient.“There was another Polish address and name on the box.“When I opened the box inside I discovered six well-wrapped gts which I presumed were maybe for children, but there could actually have been even more. I didn’t want to delve into the parcel too much, with it not belonging to me.”Both Patricia and her daughter attempted to contact parcel company DPD regarding the error in the hope the gts could reach the correct person before Christmas.She added: “We were both keen to get these parcels ed before it was too late for Christmas Day.“I realise human error can happen. We’ve made attempts to flag it up with DPD in order for them to collect the parcel. I’m not sure where that area is in Poland but it clearly still has a bit to go before it arrives with its intended party.“I contacted the call centre last week and my daughter has done the same, but no one has come to collect them.”A spokesman for DPD said the company was looking into the delivery issue.

title: confirmed dundee united announce reveal us oil businessman has taken over club
story: Dundee United have new American owners. After months of negotiations and some delays, the Tangerines have announced they are being bought over by Mark Ogren an American-based businessman.#Mark Ogren has the cash to get Dundee United back to the Premiership#" src"https:www.eveningtelegraph fp mark-ogren-has-the-cash-to-get-dundee-united-back-to-the-premiership embed # secretMuBwVQEK" data-secret"MuBwVQEK" width"" "" title"##Mark Ogren has the cash to get Dundee United back to the Premiership## # Evening " frameborder"" marginwidth"" margin"" scrolling"no"He has acquired .% of the issued share capital in Dundee United Football Company Ltd previously owned by Mike Martin and James Fyffe.Mr Ogren, whose business interests span oil services, software and real-estate, becomes chairman with Mr Martin stepping down both as chairman an director. Fyffe and David Dorward are to remain directors.United say the deal provides the strong financial foundations required to support their football ambitions.“Throughout our discussions, I was impressed by Mark’s passion for sport in general and his vision and ambition for Dundee United. He has developed a keen understanding of our rich history, our values and traditions, the importance of our community role and the passion and loyalty of the supporter base,” said Martin“I feel privileged to have been chairman at this great club and I am grateful for all the support and assistance given to me throughout that period. I leave with confidence that Dundee United’s future is in very good hands.”The deal means Martin#  months as chairman have come to and end.He took over from Stephen Thompson in early March and then in July, along with director Jim Fyffe and two anonymous local investors, he bought the former owner’s controlling interest in the club.Martin had also purchased the % shareholding of Justine Mitchell, Thompson’s sister, earlier this year.Recent documents lodged at Companies house recently confirmed Martin and Fyffe owned the % of the club.As well as paying several hundred thousand pounds for Thompson family shares, in February Martin also forked out £ million for the club’s GA Arena at Gussie Park opposite Tannadice.That money was used to pay of long-standing debt and it was stated at the time the plan was for United to buy it back from their director as soon as was possible.It’s not yet clearthat sale back to the club is part of the takeover deal.
